sponsors.marquee: Visit Inspur booth #B23 to see our latest innovations in OCP that balance efficiency and power, optimized for enterprise, cloud, and AI.
sponsors.name: Inspur
sponsors.intro: Inspur is a leading provider of data center infrastructure, cloud computing, and AI solutions, ranking among the world’s top 3 server manufacturers. As a platinum member of OCP and legacy member of other open data center communities, Inspur is a longtime contributor of open reference architectures and is committed to the development and advocacy of open standards. Through engineering and innovation, Inspur delivers cutting-edge hardware designs and solutions to address challenges across many different technology sectors.
sponsors.title: Inspur

sponsors.marquee: Energy isn't the only renewable resource.
sponsors.name: ITRenew
sponsors.intro: ITRenew, the Circular Cloud leader, is a multinational corporation creating circularity models and second lives for some of the most advanced data centre technology on the planet. With sustainably sourced products and services that power cloud and enterprise data centres, edge infrastructure, AI/ML, embedded and industrial systems worldwide, ITRenew is opening up billions in new financial opportunity across the ecosystem, slashing e-waste and CO2 impact, and making hyperscale hardware accessible to and affordable for all.
sponsors.title: ITRenew

sponsors.marquee: POWERING EXPERIENCES. See what the world can do.
sponsors.name: Samsung
sponsors.intro:
![](/img/ocp21glo_fnv_sponsorlogo-samsung.png)

Samsung Semiconductor, Inc., based in a new state-of-the-art headquarters in the heart of Silicon Valley is a multi-billion dollar subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Corp. The organization provides the world’s most advanced technology for use in smartphones, consumer electronics, computing platforms, and other devices that people use every day. Among the products researched, developed, and/or sold by Samsung DSA are state-of-the-art memory, logic, solid-state drives, host-based software, LED components, and LCD/OLED displays, which are enabling today’s most connected digital devices

sponsors.name: QCT
sponsors.intro: Quanta Cloud Technology (QCT) is a global datacenter solution provider. We combine the efficiency of hyperscale hardware with infrastructure software from a diversity of industry leaders to solve next-generation datacenter design and operation challenges. QCT serves cloud service providers, telecoms and enterprises running public, hybrid and private clouds. Product lines include hyper-converged and software-defined datacenter solutions as well as servers, storage, switches, integrated racks with a diverse ecosystem of hardware component and software partners. QCT designs, manufactures, integrates and services cutting edge offerings via its own global network. The parent of QCT is Quanta Computer, Inc., a Fortune Global 500 corporation.
sponsors.title: QCT

sponsors.name: Wiwynn Corporation
sponsors.intro: Wiywynn
sponsors.title: Wiwynn Corporation

sponsors.marquee: Ensuring the continuity of today’s and tomorrow’s vital applications.
sponsors.name: Vertiv
sponsors.intro: Nearly all aspects of our lives involve the use of technology. It is how we work and play and do anything in between. This connectivity or use of data is built into the very fabric of our society. It is vital to human progress. Vertiv believes there is a better way to meet this accelerating demand for data — one driven by passion and innovation. As industry experts, we collaborate with our customers to envision and build future-ready infrastructures. We leverage our portfolio of hardware, software, analytics, and services, to ensure our customers’ vital applications run continuously, perform optimally, and scale with business needs.

sponsors.name: Edgecore Networks
sponsors.intro: Edgecore Networks Corporation is a wholly owned subsidiary of Accton Technology Corporation, the leading network ODM. Edgecore Networks delivers wired and wireless networking products and solutions through channel partners and system integrators worldwide for Data Center, Service Provider, Enterprise and SMB customers. Edgecore Networks is the leader in open networking, providing a full line of open 1G-400G Ethernet OCP Accepted™ switches, core routers, cell site gateways, virtual PON OLTs, packet transponders, and Wi-Fi access points that offer choice of commercial and open source NOS and SDN software.
sponsors.title: Edgecore Networks

sponsors.marquee: Expanding the world's vision of what is possible!
sponsors.name: Penguin Computing
sponsors.intro: Penguin Computing specializes in custom, innovative, open solutions for AI, HPC, Data Center, and the Cloud. Penguin Computing provides hardware and software solutions built on both 19” and 21” OCP infrastructures. Founded twenty years ago by the team that created the original beowulf cluster, Penguin Computing has been integral to the development of modern HPC and data center technologies. Today, Penguin Computing focuses on four key areas, High-performance Computing, Artificial Intelligence, Software-defined Storage, and Cloud Computing solutions.
sponsors.title: Penguin Computing

slides.name: TrueHPC with Scyld ClusterWare Driving innovation with ready-to-run HPC

sponsors.name: Super Micro Computer, Inc.
sponsors.intro: Supermicro® (NASDAQ: SMCI), the leading innovator in high-performance, high-efficiency server technology is a premier provider of advanced Server Building Block Solutions® for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/Big Data, HPC and Embedded Systems worldwide. Supermicro is committed to protecting the environment through its “We Keep IT Green®” initiative and provides customers with the most energy-efficient, environmentally-friendly solutions available on the market. Visit www.supermicro.com for details and follow Supermicro on Facebook and Twitter.
sponsors.title: Super Micro Computer, Inc.

sponsors.name: TE Connectivity
sponsors.intro: TE Connectivity is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive and connected future. Their broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions, proven in the harshest environments, enable advancements in transportation, industrial applications, medical technology, energy, data communications and the home. With approximately 80,000 employees, including more than 7,500 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 140 countries, TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS.
sponsors.title: TE Connectivity

sponsors.marquee: DriveNets builds networks like cloud, over a fully virtualized cloud-native architecture - scalable, demand-responsive and innovations-ready.
sponsors.name: DriveNets
sponsors.intro: DriveNets is a leader in cloud-native networking software and network disaggregation solutions. Founded in 2015 and based in Israel, DriveNets offers communications service providers (CSPs) and cloud providers a radical new way to build networks, substantially growing their profitability by changing their technological and economic models. DriveNets’ solution – Network Cloud – adapts the architectural model of cloud to telco-grade networking. Network Cloud is a cloud-native software that runs over a shared physical infrastructure of standard white-boxes, radically simplifying the network’s operations, offering telco-scale performance and elasticity at a much lower cost.

sponsors.name: NVIDIA
sponsors.intro: NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU sparked the PC gaming market. The company’s pioneering work in accelerated computing—a supercharged form of computing at the intersection of computer graphics, high performance computing and AI—is reshaping trillion-dollar industries, such as transportation, healthcare and manufacturing, and fueling the growth of many others.

sponsors.name: Experience Center (MAIN)
sponsors.intro:
The Experience Center at the OCP Global Summit is a dedicated space for the Community to showcase their hardware designs, architecture and software solutions on OCP-recognized hardware platforms. The OCP Experience Center was established in 2019 to provide new ways for OCP members to showcase best-in-class product demos, both live and static. The initiative was launched at the OCP Global and Regional (European) Summits last year, and they were among the most popular attractions. Not only do the partners get a chance to showcase their OCP Accepted™ and OCP Inspired™ product offerings, they also get a chance to receive feedback from Summit attendees. The OCP Experience Center offers Summit attendees a chance to explore products and their piece-parts, and see through the software solutions that have been built primarily for the platforms being demonstrated.

**To explore all each Experience Center's content, in the right column, click the center you want to learn more about!**

**[Hardware Management Center](/a/sponsor/85-hardware-management)**

**[Open System Firmware](/a/sponsor/86-open-system-firmware)**

**[Tap Center ](/a/sponsor/87-tap)**

**[Networking Center ](/a/sponsor/89-networking)** 

**[Telco Center](/a/sponsor/90-telco)**

**[Server Center ](/a/sponsor/91-server)**

**[OAI Center](/a/sponsor/92-oai)**

**[Test and Validation Center ](/a/sponsor/93-test-and-validation)**

**[Storage Experience Center](/a/sponsor/94-storage)**
sponsors.title: Experience Center

sponsors.marquee: Total solution packaged with Linuxboot, Coreboot, OpenBMC along with BIOS on OCP hardware.
sponsors.name: Open System Firmware
sponsors.intro:
Participating companies are Facebook, Intel, AMI and ITRenew.

Demo's Include: 

1. Wiwynn DeltaLake with coreboot + LinuxBoot +OpenBMC 

2. Monolake (Existing older platform) with coreboot + LinuxBoot +OpenBMC 

3. MinPlatform (one of the OSF stacks) Demo 

4. TiogaPass with Aptio Open Edition. 

5. ARM LBBR or SBBR (Server based boot requirements) 

6. Supermicro Ice Lake with MinPlatform
sponsors.title: Explore more about Open System Firmware Station

sponsors.marquee: Showcase total management capabilities including firmware updates, profile capabilities, building MegaRAC and test.
sponsors.name: Hardware Management
sponsors.intro:
Participating companies are Intel, Edgecore, AMI and Lattice Semiconductor

Describe: Showcase management capabilities. Show OpenRMC 1.1 firmware updates, group operations etc. 

OCP Prescribed: Showcase baseline/server profiles. Focus on Reset, Inventory, LocationLED Implement: Experience building OpenBMC (?), MegaRAC (AMI), OpenRMC (Inspur/Wiwynn) Experience Device Manager (Edge-core) Experience the HW Mgmt Modules (RunBMC, SCM 1.0, SCM 2.0) (Intel) 

Conform: Experience running the tests specified in supplier checklist. Tests based on Redfish service validator, interface validator, interop-validator
sponsors.title: Explore more about Hardware Management Station

sponsors.marquee: Machine synchronization by data packets will be shown along with performance of time protocols with the OCP time card.
sponsors.name: TAP
sponsors.intro:
Participating Companies are Facebook and NVIDIA.

**Live Demo**: "Synchronizing machines by data packets” Performance of NTP vs PTP w or w/o time card. Time Synchronized Database throughput. Using Time Card, Atomic Clock, GPS 

**Static Demo**: Announcing the Open Time Server Ref-Arch Time Card, NIC, How to get started
sponsors.title: Explore more about TAP Station

sponsors.marquee: DDC orchestration with a live and a static demo.
sponsors.name: Networking
sponsors.intro:

**Live Demo:** "DDC Orchestration" > Remotely Controlling a large DDC Cluster install in Israel 

**Static Demo:** 350Tb Jericho2C+ Cluster w/MACSEC > Hyperscale sized routing platform

sponsors.marquee: Peering router demo showcasing a small VDR cluster peering with two BGP peers.
sponsors.name: Telco
sponsors.intro:
Participating companies are Arrcus, UFISpace and Credo.

Virtualized Distributed Router (VDR) Small Cluster leveraging UfiSpace hardware platforms based on Broadcom J2/Ramon 

**Live Demo:** Show case Arrcus peering fabric; an interconnect to various servce providers, CDNs
sponsors.title: Explore more about Telco

sponsors.name: Server
sponsors.intro:
Server Experience Center

Participating Companies are XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX

In the OCP NIC 3.0 experience center, our goal is to show demonstrations covering physical, logical, and functional aspects of OCP NIC 3.0 specification. Overall, we have planned seven demonstrations. We have two demonstrations showing interface sandbox with a Small Form Factor (SFF) as well as a Tall SFF NIC product respectively. We will be showing a mechanical fit-test fixture that can be used to check a physical card's compliance with OCP NIC 3.0 specification. There will be a demonstration of connectivity and manageability features of OCP NIC 3.0 specification on a Multi-Host NIC with hosts running timing and TCP applications. We also plan to showcase Fiber channel HBA in OCP NIC 3.0 form factor and a server with 12 OCP NIC 3.0 compliant slots. Finally, we will be tying both OCP NIC 3.0 and device attestation specifications by showing the attestation of OCP NIC 3.0 compliant Ethernet NIC using Secure Protocol Data Model (SPDM), one of the attestation protocols recommended by the OCP security project.
sponsors.title: Explore more about Server
